metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27618 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-27618` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.33-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.33-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.33-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33-0ubuntu1').
